events.summary:
Countries’ drop in scores in annual table comes amid ‘worrying trend’ of backsliding in established democracies

The UK and US have sunk to new lows in a global index of corruption, amid a “worrying trend” of democratic institutions being eroded by political donations, cash for access and state targeting of campaigners and journalists.

Experts and businesspeople rated 182 countries based on their perception of corruption levels in the public sector to compile a league table that was bookended by Denmark at the top with the lowest levels of corruption and South Sudan at the bottom.

Continue reading...

events.title: Italian reporters to protest over boss’s gaffe-filled Olympic commentary
events.summary:
Director of state broadcaster Rai Sport welcomed viewers to wrong stadium and mistook Italian actor for Mariah Carey

Sports journalists at the Italian state broadcaster are staging protests in response to blunders made by the sports director throughout his commentary on the opening ceremony of the Milano Cortina Winter Olympics.

Paolo Petrecca, who was appointed to the role at Rai Sport in 2025, first welcomed viewers to Rome’s Stadio Olimpico instead of Milan’s San Siro, where Friday’s ceremony was held, before mistaking the Italian actor Matilda De Angelis for Mariah Carey and Kirsty Coventry, president of the International Olympic Committee, for Laura Mattarella, daughter of the Italian president.

Continue reading...

events.title: Israeli court blocks life-saving cancer care for boy, 5, due to his Gaza address
events.summary:
Palestinian boy has been in the West Bank since 2022 but is still registered as a resident in the strip where ban applies

An Israeli court has rejected an appeal to allow a five-year-old Palestinian boy with an aggressive form of cancer to enter Israel for life-saving treatment, citing a government policy that bars residents registered in Gaza from crossing the border, even when they no longer live there.

In a ruling issued on Sunday, the Jerusalem district court dismissed a petition seeking permission to transfer the child from Ramallah to Tel HaShomer hospital near Tel Aviv for a bone marrow transplant – a procedure unavailable in either Gaza or the occupied West Bank. The boy has been in the West Bank since 2022 where he was receiving medical care unavailable in the Gaza Strip. His doctors have determined that he urgently requires antibody immunotherapy.

Continue reading...

events.title: Trump White House voices opposition after Israel unveils plan to increase control over West Bank
events.summary:
Israel’s security cabinet has approved plans that pave the way for more settlements in the occupied Palestinian territory

A White House official has reiterated Donald Trump’s opposition towards Israel annexing the West Bank, after Israeli plans were announced that would pave the way for more settlements in the occupied Palestinian territory.

The measures, announced on Sunday, included allowing Jewish Israelis to buy West Bank land directly, and extending greater Israeli control over areas where the Palestinian Authority exercises power. It was unclear when the new rules, approved by Israel’s security cabinet, would take effect but they do not require further approval.

Continue reading...

events.title: Iran arrests leading reformists close to the country’s president
events.summary:
Detentions of senior Reformists Front figures follow criticism of the authorities’ handling of recent protests

The head of Iran’s Reformists Front, the organisation instrumental in securing the election of the country’s president, Masoud Pezeshkian, has been arrested by the Islamic Revolutionary Guards Corps (IRGC) in a move that is likely to exacerbate tensions over the handling of recent street protests.

Azar Mansouri, the secretary general of the Islamic Iran People party, had expressed deep sorrow at protesters’ deaths, and said nothing could justify such a catastrophe. She had not in public called for the supreme leader, Ali Khamenei, to resign.

Continue reading...

events.title: Iran sentences Nobel laureate Narges Mohammadi to seven more years in prison
events.summary:
Women’s and human rights activist, arrested at a demonstration in December, is said to be on hunger strike

Iran has sentenced the Nobel peace prize laureate Narges Mohammadi to more than seven more years in prison after she began a hunger strike, her supporters said Sunday, as Tehran cracks down on all dissent following nationwide protests and the deaths of thousands at the hands of security forces.

The new convictions against Mohammadi come as Iran tries to negotiate with the US over its nuclear programme to avert a military strike threatened by Donald Trump. Iran’s top diplomat said on Sunday that Tehran’s strength came from its ability to “say no to the great powers”, striking a maximalist position just after negotiations in Oman with the US.

Continue reading...

events.title: BBC Persian journalists say Iran monitoring them and targeting their families
events.summary:
Reporters say relatives in Iran have been questioned and persecuted in an effort to curb coverage of unrest

Exiled Iranian journalists working for the BBC have been warned their movements are being closely monitored by the state, as they said their families in Iran were being interrogated and persecuted for their reporting.

Journalists said family members had been threatened with arrest and the seizure of their assets unless their loved ones stopped reporting on Iranian unrest.

Continue reading...

events.title: Traditional food could help reverse Nepal’s ‘diabetes epidemic’, studies suggest
events.summary:
With medication largely unaffordable in the country, experts hope community support and a change in diet could reduce soaring type 2 diabetes rates

A return to the traditional lentil and rice dishes that have nourished generations of Nepalis could save them from a diabetes epidemic prompted by the influx of western junk foods, doctors have said.

In a country where one in five of those over 40 has type 2 diabetes, the foods enjoyed by their grandparents have showed remarkable results in reversing the condition.

Continue reading...

events.title: One person dead from Nipah virus in Bangladesh, WHO says
events.summary:
The case in Bangladesh, where Nipah cases are reported almost every year, follows two Nipah virus cases identified in neighbouring India

The World Health Organization said on Friday that a woman had died in northern Bangladesh in January after contracting the deadly Nipah virus infection.

The case in Bangladesh, where Nipah cases are reported almost every year, follows two Nipah virus cases identified in neighbouring India, which has already prompted stepped-up airport screenings across Asia.

Continue reading...

events.title: Mosque bombing in Pakistan capital kills at least 31 people
events.summary:
Police investigating whether blast that injured at least 169 at Friday prayers in Islamabad was suicide attack

An explosion has ripped through a Shia mosque on the outskirts of Pakistan’s capital during Friday prayers, killing 31 people and injuring at least 169 others, according to officials. Police said they were investigating whether the attack was carried out by a suicide bomber.

There were fears the death toll from the blast at the Khadija al-Kubra mosque in Islamabad could rise as some of the injured were reported to be in a critical condition. Television footage and social media images showed police and residents transporting the injured to nearby hospitals.

Continue reading...

events.title: Pakistan targets Balochistan separatists after ‘unprecedented’ assaults
events.summary:
Officials say calm restored to province day after dozens killed in suicide and gun attacks in at least 10 cities

Pakistan’s security forces have intensified their operations against separatist militants in Balochistan province who launched a large-scale assault on Saturday in which at least 31 civilians and 17 security personnel were killed.

A day after the militants carried out suicide attacks in the heart of the province’s capital, Quetta, the chief minister of the south-western region, Sarfraz Bugti, said 145 people he described as militants had been killed in 40 hours and that their bodies were in the custody of the authorities.

Continue reading...

events.title: Inside Myanmar’s five-year armed resistance – a photo essay
events.summary:
Five years after the junta’s coup, the civil war devastating Myanmar has reached a turning point. The military is carrying out large-scale counter-offensives across the country to reclaim territory seized by pro-democracy rebels of various ethnic and religious backgrounds

In Tanintharyi, the southernmost region of Myanmar, the local resistance has managed to contain the military. After five years of guerrilla warfare, the revolutionary youth there remain determined to restore democracy through armed struggle.

A long, narrow stretch of land at the southern tip of Myanmar, between the Andaman Sea to the west and Thailand to the east, Tanintharyi region is one of the areas where the resistance challenges the military’s authority. For decades, the region has been home to an armed rebellion led by the Karen ethnic minority, which operated mainly in the peripheral mountains.

Soldiers from the Karen National Union (KNU) inspect the ruins of a Buddhist monastery destroyed by a junta airstrike in Myeik district, Tanintharyi region

Continue reading...

events.title: Welsh first minister Eluned Morgan backs Starmer but says he must ‘deliver for Wales’ – UK politics live
events.summary:
The prime minister Keir Starmer is hoping to push forward on policy following a bruising week for his leadership

There are two urgent questions in the Commons after 12.30pm: on the Ministry of Defence’s contracts with Palantir, and on the Ministry of Justice’s “impending deletion of the Courtsdesk court reporting data archive”. Both have been tabled by the Tories.

After they are over, Ed Miliband is making a statement about the local power plan. (See 11.02am.)

I support the prime minister in the job he was elected to do. After years of revolving-door leadership under the Conservatives, the country needs stability in an age of instability, and that matters for Wales.

I had concerns that Peter Mandelson was incompatible with public office because of the company he kept. What has since come to light has only reinforced those concerns.

Continue reading...

events.title: Teen boy who admitted to killing 12-year-old Leo Ross to be sentenced – live updates
events.summary:
The 12-year-old was stabbed by a stranger as he walked home from school in January 2025

According to the Mirror, one application from the media has been raised by Carl Jackson, a court reporter for Birmingham Live.

Justice Choudhury KC has adjourned the court to re-read submissions from the media who want the defendant’s name to be revealed. The court is expected to reconvene in about half an hour.

Continue reading...

events.title: New archbishop of Canterbury vows to build trust in how church tackles abuse
events.summary:
Sarah Mullally says Church of England has ‘fallen tragically short’ after predecessor resigned over significant failings

The new archbishop of Canterbury has pledged to rebuild trust and confidence in the way the Church of England deals with the abuse of children and vulnerable adults, saying that in the past it has “fallen tragically short”.

Sarah Mullally told a meeting of the C of E’s ruling body, the General Synod, that “proper independence” would be central to the way the church dealt with allegations of abuse on her watch as archbishop. The C of E has been criticised for dealing with allegations of abuse, and complaints about the handling of such allegations, internally.

Continue reading...

events.title: BT replaces Openreach boss in latest management shake-up
events.summary:
Clive Selley, who oversaw £12bn rollout of full fibre broadband to 25m homes, will lead international division

  • Business live – latest updates

The head of BT’s infrastructure arm Openreach is to step down after almost a decade, having almost completed a £12bn rollout of full fibre broadband to 25m homes.

Clive Selley, who was tasked by former BT chief Philip Jansen to “build like fury” to address the UK’s status as global laggard in the rollout of high-speed broadband, will become the boss of BT’s international division.

Continue reading...

events.title: BP halts share buy-backs as annual profits slide
events.summary:
Pressure mounts on oil and gas company as it aims for turnaround under new chief executive

  • Business live – latest updates

BP has halted share buy-backs after reporting weaker annual profits as it prepares to continue a plan to resuscitate its fortunes under a new chief executive.

The company’s underlying earnings fell to just below $7.5bn (£5.5bn) for 2025, from almost $9bn for 2024, after global oil prices fell for a third consecutive year and at the steepest rate since the Covid pandemic.

Continue reading...

events.title: Local police aid ICE by tapping school cameras amid Trump’s immigration crackdown
events.summary:
Local police assisted federal immigration agents by repeatedly searching school cameras that record license plate numbers, data show

Police departments across the US are quietly leveraging school district security cameras to assist Donald Trump’s mass immigration enforcement campaign, an investigation by the 74 reveals.

Hundreds of thousands of audit logs spanning a month show police are searching a national database of automated license plate reader data, including from school cameras, for immigration-related investigations.

Continue reading...

events.title: Democrats reject White House ICE offer as partial shutdown looms – US politics live
events.summary:
Schumer and Jeffries says White House proposal is ‘incomplete and insufficient’ as prospect of deal recedes

Israeli prime minister Benjamin Netanyahu has said he will prioritise discussions on negotiations with Iran when he meets with US president Donald Trump in Washington this week.

“On this trip we will discuss a range of issues: Gaza, the region, but of course first and foremost the negotiations with Iran. I will present to the president our views regarding the principles for the negotiations,” Netanyahu said before heading to the United States, where he will meet Trump on Wednesday.

Continue reading...

events.title: DoJ accused of cover-up after lawmakers view unredacted Epstein files | First Thing
events.summary:
Jamie Raskin, House judiciary ranking member, says ‘mysterious redactions’ obscure abusers’ names. Plus, RFK Jr accused of misleading Senate

Good morning.

A top House Democrat on Monday accused the justice department of making “mysterious redactions” to documents related to Jeffrey Epstein that obscured the names of abusers, while also allowing the identities of the disgraced financier’s victims to become public.

What did Raskin say? He told reporters “there were tons of completely unnecessary redactions, in addition to the failure to redact the names of victims, and so that was troubling to us”.

What happens next? “We’re going to start by posing questions directly to attorney general [Pam] Bondi about the process that produced such flawed results, and that has created such mystery,” Raskin said.

How bad does it look? The US fell from 28th place to 29th, overtaken by Lithuania, recording its lowest ever score of 64. (Transparency International said the score did not factor in all of the events of 2025.)

What about globally? The report identified an overall global deterioration, as 31 countries improved their score while 50 declined.

Continue reading...

events.title: Chappell Roan drops Casey Wasserman talent agency after Epstein files revelations
events.summary:
Wasserman has apologised for communicating with Ghislaine Maxwell after flirtatious emails they exchanged more than 20 years ago were released in the Epstein files

Pop star Chappell Roan said on Monday she was no longer represented by the talent agency led by Los Angeles 2028 Olympics chief Casey Wasserman, who has faced criticism for flirtatious email exchanges with convicted sex trafficker Ghislaine Maxwell more than 20 years ago.

Wasserman has apologised for communicating with Maxwell, after the publication of a series of personal emails between the two.

Continue reading...

events.title: Trump once endorsed the US-Canada bridge he’s now railing against – as it happened
events.summary:
This live blog is now closed.

  • Trump threatens to block new bridge in latest tirade against Canada

  • Trump news at a glance: Europe must stand up to Trump and his ‘demolition men’, new report says

Ghislaine Maxwell, the convicted sex trafficker and longtime accomplice of Jeffrey Epstein, is set to attend a virtual deposition for the House oversight committee at 10am ET today.

This is part of the committee’s ongoing investigation into the handling of Epstein’s case,

Continue reading...

events.title: Cuban fuel shortage: U.S. blockade of oil grounds flights in Cuba
events.summary: Cuba's fuel shortage hits during peak tourist season, grounding flights as the Trump administration's pressure tightens the island's oil supplies.

events.title: Israel passes measure to make purchasing real estate from Palestinians easier
events.summary: The Israeli government has passed measures to ease West Bank land purchases for settlers and strengthen control in the occupied territory

events.title: Venezuela's Congress to vote on amnesty law that will free political prisoners
events.summary: Weeks after Nicolás Maduro's ousting, Venezuelans cautiously test new freedoms as the country's Congress prepares to vote on an amnesty law that will free hundreds of political prisoners.

events.title: Japan's Takaichi to pursue conservative agenda after election landslide
events.summary: Japan's first female Prime Minister, Sanae Takaichi, brought the ruling Liberal Democratic Party its biggest-ever electoral victory, fueling her ambitions to pursue to a political agenda which she says could "split public opinion."

events.title: Japan's ruling party wins a supermajority in country's lower house
events.summary: Japan's ruling party scored its biggest electoral win in its seven-decade history Sunday, due mostly to the popularity of its first female prime minister, Sanae Takaichi.

events.title: Ukrainian president says US set June deadline for Russia and Ukraine to end war
events.summary: Ukraine's President Zelenskyy said the U.S. has set a June deadline for Kyiv and Moscow to end the war, even as Washington and Russia discuss $12 trillion in economic deals that could affect Ukraine.

events.title: Hong Kong media tycoon Jimmy Lai sentenced to 20 years in prison
events.summary: A Hong Kong court sentenced 78-year-old activist and publisher Jimmy Lai to 20 years in prison after finding him guilty under China's national security law.

events.title: Iran's crackdown on dissent widens to ensnare reformist figures
events.summary: Detained Nobel Peace Prize laureate Narges Mohammadi has received another prison sentence of over seven years.

events.title: China critic and former media tycoon Jimmy Lai sentenced to 20 years in Hong Kong
events.summary: Jimmy Lai, the pro-democracy former Hong Kong media tycoon and a fierce critic of Beijing, was sentenced on Monday to 20 years in prison in the longest punishment given so far under a China-imposed national security law that has virtually silenced the city's dissent.

events.title: Center-left Socialist candidate wins over populist in Portugal's presidential runoff
events.summary: Center-left Socialist candidate António José Seguro recorded a thumping victory over hard-right populist André Ventura in Portugal's runoff presidential election Sunday, according to official results.

events.title: Is Netflix making us stupid?
events.summary: Netflix is increasingly designing films and series for distracted, second-screen viewers. DW's Scott Roxborough asks what it means for storytelling, visual language and the future of cinema as an art form.

events.title: Israel: Netanyahu heads to US as Iran negotiations loom
events.summary: The Israeli leader will meet US President Donald Trump on Wednesday, with Washington's negotiations with Iran taking center stage.

events.title: IOC bars Ukrainian skeleton racer from wearing memorial helmet at Milano-Cortina Olympics
events.summary: Ukraine's bid to let skeleton racer Vladyslav Heraskevych use a helmet honoring athletes killed in the war with Russia has been rejected by the International Olympic Committee.

events.title: Slovakia's embattled LGBTQ+ community hopes for change
events.summary: New restrictive legislation in Slovakia comes despite rising public acceptance of same-sex couples, making the situation for the LGBTQ+ community complex and contradictory.

events.title: Macron warns Europe faces political and economic crisis
events.summary: The French president urged EU leaders to confront competition from the US and China and back a "Made in Europe" strategy.

events.title: Germany news: Berlin releases report on hidden violence
events.summary: Germany has released its first report on violence that goes unreported, both behind closed doors and in public. Meanwhile, a series of so-called "warning strikes" is being staged by public sector unions. DW has more.

events.title: Germany: Queer referee attacked after viral proposal
events.summary: Referee Pascal Kaiser went viral after proposing to his boyfriend during a Bundesliga game. Then, the 27-year-old was attacked, though the motive is still unclear.

events.title: US: Meta, YouTube on trial over kids' social media addiction
events.summary: This bellwether case in the US could reshape the design of social media for children. A plaintiff alleged that Meta and YouTube designed addictive features that harm children's mental health.

events.title: US: Trump threatens to block opening of bridge with Canada
events.summary: The US President Donald Trump said Canada should "fully compensate" Washington for "everything we have given them." The bridge is fully paid for by the Canadian government.

events.title: 2025 Corruption Index flags drops in Western nations
events.summary: Once seen as anti-graft strongholds, the US, UK, Canada and Sweden are slipping into decline due to a lack of political leadership, Transparency International's Corruption Perception Index has revealed.

events.title: US, Armenia sign nuclear deal during Vance visit
events.summary: During a visit by Vice President JD Vance, the US and Armenia agreed to cooperate in the civil nuclear sector. Vance will also travel to Azerbaijan, hoping to finalize a peace deal.

events.title: Cricket: India-Pakistan T20 World Cup clash back on after boycott ends
events.summary: Pakistan had decided to forfeit its high-profile T20 World Cup match against India after the ICC rejected Bangladesh's security concerns about playing in India and replaced them with Scotland.

events.title: US cuts Bangladesh tariffs to 19% in trade deal
events.summary: Certain textiles and garments made in Bangladesh from US-produced materials will attract zero tariffs.

events.title: UK's King Charles 'concerned' by Andrew's actions amid Epstein fallout
events.summary: King Charles says he will support police probing his brother's ties to the disgraced financier Jeffrey Epstein. The scandal is threatening to overshadow Prince William's visit to Saudi Arabia.

events.title: US seizes sanctioned oil tanker in Indian Ocean
events.summary: The Pentagon says US forces boarded a Panamanian-flagged oil tanker that attempted to evade them after departing the Caribbean. It is not entirely clear if the vessel was tied to Venezuela's shadow fleet.

events.title: MSC braces for more of Trump's 'wrecking-ball politics'
events.summary: Chairman Wolfgang Ischinger tells DW the 2026 Munich Security Conference comes when "obviously, trust has been damaged" by President Trump. But he also says US calls for a more "self-reliant" Europe are fair and overdue.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell avoids questions in House deposition
events.summary: Maxwell chose to invoke the Fifth Amendment and stay silent in order to not incriminate herself. Democrats say Maxwell, an associate of Jeffrey Epstein, will not cooperate because she wants a pardon from Trump.

events.title: UK: Keir Starmer clings on, party ally calls on him to quit
events.summary: The Scottish Labour leader Anas Sarwar has called on Starmer to quit. But the PM says he has no intention of stepping down, even as a second top aide in as many days falls on his sword.

events.title: Thailand: What's next after PM Anutin's big election win?
events.summary: PM Anutin's Bhumjaithai party has defied expectations and won the most seats in the general election. The reformist People's Party struggled to define itself against the incumbents.

events.title: Fact check: Fake viral posts after Bad Bunny Super Bowl show
events.summary: Bad Bunny made history performing the Super Bowl halftime show in Spanish. Meanwhile, disinformation about the global superstar is going viral. A DW fact check.

events.title: Germany's gas reserves face crucial energy supply test
events.summary: Germany's gas reserves fell to concerning levels of just above 30% in February. Will the supplies hold up if the cold snap persists?

events.title: Global economy needs nature to thrive
events.summary: A world-first report exploring the interdependence between business and biodiversity shows how the destruction of nature is undermining global prosperity — and ways to fix it.

events.title: Sweden to raise hurdles to gaining citizenship
events.summary: Starting in June, Sweden will require that people have lived in the country for 8 years, earn a modest income and pass a test to gain citizenship. Successive governments have tightened migration rules since 2016.

events.title: Germany's neoliberal FDP: No chance for a comeback?
events.summary: The neoliberal Free Democratic Party played a decisive role in shaping politics in Germany. After a wipeout in the last federal election, the party is fighting for survival ahead of important state elections.

events.title: Germany news: Carnival season set to generate €2 billion
events.summary: Economists predict that an unusually short carnival season will still deliver a significant economic boost. Meanwhile, the trial resumes of a mother accused of hiding her daughter away for seven years. DW has the latest.

events.title: Ukraine updates: Child killed in Russian drone strike
events.summary: A mother and child were among the casualties of a Russian strike in Ukraine's Kharkiv region. Meanwhile, a Ukrainian man has been indicted in Germany for his alleged involvement in parcel bomb attacks. DW has more.

events.title: Spain: Rail strike begins as drivers protest safety failures
events.summary: Two deadly accidents, including one of the worst in Europe, have drawn attention to maintenance issues in the Spanish railway system.

events.title: Portugal: Socialist Seguro wins big in presidential election
events.summary: Veteran center-left politician Antonio Jose Seguro has won 66% of the vote, seeing off a challenge from the far-right.

events.title: Super Bowl 2026: Seattle Seahawks beat New England Patriots
events.summary: The Seattle Seahawks have defeated the New England Patriots in the NFL's showpiece event, with Puerto Rican singer Bad Bunny making history by performing the halftime show in Spanish.

events.title: Albania's judicial reform 10 years on: Hope without justice
events.summary: In 2016, Albania launched a reform program aimed at strengthening its judiciary and making it a pillar in the fight against corruption. The murder of a judge last October has reignited the debate about this reform.

events.title: Memorial for Swiss bar blaze victims catches fire
events.summary: A makeshift memorial for the 41 people killed on News Years Eve at the resort inferno in Crans-Montana caught fire. The memorial site was a place for mourners to place candles, messages and plush toys.

events.title: UK PM aide quits over pick of Epstein-linked US envoy
events.summary: Keir Starmer's top aide Morgan McSweeney has quit amid fallout over the appointment of Britain's former US ambassador. Criticism has mounted as new details emerged of the appointee's links to Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Germany's Aicher wins Olympic ski silver as Vonn crashes
events.summary: Germany has earned its first medal of the Winter Games as Emma Aicher finished second in a tight downhill ski race. The event was disrupted after US skier Lindsey Vonn was airlifted away following a severe fall.

events.title: Fake Berlin Wall fragments on sale as souvenirs?
events.summary: It's been nearly 40 years since the fall of the Berlin Wall but you can still buy pieces of it in the German capital as souvenirs. Are they the real deal?

events.title: Why scientists warn of privately funded geoengineering
events.summary: As the climate crisis intensifies, interest in solar engineering is increasing, including among private companies and investors. But the technique is controversial and lacks regulation.

events.title: Could Hungary win its case against the EU's Russian gas ban?
events.summary: The EU has banned the import of all Russian gas by the end of 2027. Hungary is taking the matter to the European Court of Justice — and some legal experts think it might have a chance.

events.title: Arrest in Dubai after shooting of Russian general — FSB
events.summary: A Russian national has been detained in the United Arab Emirates in connection with Friday's shooting of military intelligence officer ⁠Vladimir ‍Alekseyev. The Kremlin blamed Ukraine for the attempted assassination.

events.title: Milan: Protest ends in clashes near Olympic Village
events.summary: Police used tear gas and water cannons on dozens of protesters near the Olympic Village in Milan. Protesters were demonstrating over the environmental impact of the games and also the presence of US ICE agents.

events.title: How the Epstein-Barr virus triggers MS in some people
events.summary: Multiple sclerosis is also caused by a virus carried by almost all humans. A new study provides an explanation as to why only certain people develop the disease. This also opens up the possibility of a treatment.

events.title: Greenland, Denmark say US talks positive but future unclear
events.summary: The foreign ministers of Greenland and Denmark say they hope to resolve the existential threat posed to both by US President Donald Trump's obsession with taking possession of the autonomous Arctic territory.

events.title: Families call for truth on Kosovo War's missing people
events.summary: Some 1,600 people are still missing from the Kosovo War, though it ended nearly three decades ago. Serbia has blocked efforts to shed light on their fates. But now, Kosovo and Serbia's joint commission has finally met.

events.title: France: Ex-minister Jack Lang resigns amid Epstein probe
events.summary: Before resigning from a leading Paris cultural center, Lang said the probe against him was "baseless." His name appeared more than 670 times in the files relating to the late, disgraced financier Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Italian police probe 'sabotage' on rail lines to Olympics
events.summary: Three incidents of damage to rail infrastructure around Bologna in northern Italy are being investigated. Authorities said journeys to day one of the Winter Olympic Games have been disrupted.

events.title: Article 42.7: Are EU states compelled to collective defense?
events.summary: EU member states are legally obligated to provide mutual assistance under Article 42.7 of the bloc’s treaties. But are states ready to honor that promise in the event of an attack?

events.title: Pingtok: Teenagers taking drugs on TikTok
events.summary: Under the hashtag #Pingtok, teenagers film themselves getting high, connect with dealers and reach millions on TikTok. How dangerous is the social media trend?

events.title: Ukraine updates: Russia strikes war-hit nation’s power grid
events.summary: Russian strikes target energy infrastructure across Ukraine, knocking out power, damaging power plants and deepening winter hardship. Meanwhile, Trump wants the war to end by June, Zelenskyy says.

events.title: Germans increasingly concerned over social inequality
events.summary: Chancellor Friedrich Merz and his conservatives have seen a dip in the polls. This follows weeks of debates over the latest controversial proposals to restructure Germany's welfare state.

events.title: 2026 Winter Olympics opening ceremony — as it happened
events.summary: The 2026 Winter Olympics opening ceremony is finally here. DW followed the official opening to the 25th edition of the games live in Milan.

events.title: Norway crown princess apologizes to royals for Epstein ties
events.summary: Mette-Marit's relationship with late sex offender Jeffrey Epstein comes as her son faces trial for rape and assault. The Epstein scandal is also affecting high-profile politicians in other European countries.

events.title: German train conductor's death highlights rise in violence
events.summary: Following a fatal attack on a railway employee, a debate has erupted in Germany about how such incidents can be prevented.

events.title: Women's Bundesliga dispute shows no sign of ending
events.summary: The future of women’s football in Germany remains in limbo, with the country’s top league and its association (DFB) wrestling for control. Germany's top clubs are refusing to work with the DFB, at least for now.

events.title: China grows while Europe slows in South American EV market
events.summary: China's electric carmakers are rapidly expanding across South America as Europe hesitates with trade liberalization. From Brazil to Argentina, a high-stakes battle is unfolding for the region's future auto market.

events.title: Cycle syncing exercise could optimize results for women
events.summary: Women in gyms hear it all the time: lift heavy in some weeks, go lighter in others, depending on your menstrual cycle — because your hormones affect your strength. But is it backed by science?

events.title: Berlin hospitals threatened by spate of attacks
events.summary: Hospitals in Germany's capital are reporting an increasing number of suspicious incidents, including cyberattacks, drone flights and arson. Experts warn that healthcare facilities are easy targets.

events.title: Russia expels German diplomat in tit-for-tat espionage row
events.summary: Russia has declared a military attache at the German Embassy in Moscow persona non grata. It called the move a response to Germany expelling a diplomat and accusing them of espionage, a charge the Kremlin rejects.

events.title: The fight for American football in Europe
events.summary: After the fall of the European League of Football, two rival organizations have emerged to fill the gap. Can they succeed where others, including the NFL, failed?

events.title: Trump to be exposed at Cologne Carnival's Rose Monday parade
events.summary: Donald Trump, Friedrich Merz and Emmanuel Macron are all targets of satirical floats at this year's Rose Monday Parade in Cologne. But Vladimir Putin will be spared — and there is a reason for that.

events.title: How US Project Vault challenges China's rare-earth dominance
events.summary: Donald Trump's Project Vault seeks to secure US access to rare earth minerals vital for advanced tech and clean energy. The EU wants a minerals alliance with Washington, but can they really shift China's outsized lead?

events.title: Winter Olympics begin quietly with curling
events.summary: The mixed doubles curling event kicked off the Milan-Cortina Winter Olympics two days before the official opening of the Games.

events.title: Court in Hungary declares German anti-fascist Maja T. guilty
events.summary: Maja T., a nonbinary anti-fascist activist from Germany, has been sentenced to eight years in prison in Budapest. The trial has been controversial and has political implications.

events.title: 2026 Winter Olympics: What you need to know
events.summary: This Friday, the 25th Winter Olympics will open in Milan and Cortina d'Ampezzo. How big will the Games be? Will Russia be allowed to participate in the competitions — and what about security and doping?

events.title: World Cancer Day: Smoking, infections and alcohol cause 4 in 10 preventable cancer cases
events.summary: A new WHO study suggests that over 7 million cases of cancer in 2022 were preventable. Nearly 40% of all the cases that year were linked to modifiable risk factors — behavioral and environmental factors we can change.

events.title: Tiny dinosaur fossil could provide evolutionary clues: study
events.summary: Scientists have said fossils of a small newly discovered dinosaur found in Spain could change ideas on the evolution of ornithopods.

events.title: Tackling forever chemicals could save money and our health
events.summary: Critics say a new UK plan to tackle forever chemicals does not match proposed measures in the EU. As European governments try to deal with the growing PFAS pollution, cleaning it up could cost up to €1.7 trillion.

events.title: India's oil shake-up: Can Venezuela really replace Russia?
events.summary: Donald Trump says India has agreed to replace Russian oil with US supplies — and maybe even Venezuelan. DW asks whether the Latin American producer can realistically meet New Delhi's needs.

events.title: Germany and the Gulf region: Energy and arms deals
events.summary: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz is visiting three Gulf states within just 72 hours. He is pursuing new "strategic partnerships" — as Germany's friendship with the United States is becoming increasingly fragile.

events.title: Uhlaender low on Olympic options after CAS appeal fails
events.summary: Katie Uhlaender says she was unfairly denied the chance to reach her sixth Winter Olympics by rivals Canada. The top sports court has now blocked the US skeleton athlete's latest effort to compete.

events.title: FIFA boss Infantino wants Russia to return to football
events.summary: In a surprise statement, the head of world football has said he believes it is time for Russia to return to the pitch.

events.title: Indian trade deal provides opportunity for German carmakers
events.summary: Up until now, German cars have barely penetrated the Indian market despite success elsewhere. Could the new EU-India trade deal be a game changer for the struggling sector?

events.title: Why gold and silver prices suddenly collapsed
events.summary: After hitting record highs last week, the prices of gold and silver have suddenly reversed course. DW looks at how a euphoric rally flipped into a sharp, confidence-shaking rout.

events.title: How a heckled Canadian became Germany's Olympic hockey coach
events.summary: Harold Kreis is set to head to his first Olympic Games as coach of the German men's ice hockey team. Now a legend of the game in his adopted homeland, he wasn't welcomed by all when he first arrived from Canada.

events.title: Vienna swaps parking for green space
events.summary: Conscious of reaching climate goals and strapped for space, some cities are reconsidering how much they dedicate to parking. Austria's capital, Vienna, is streets ahead.

events.title: Trump's Greenland 'piece of ice' remark echoes history
events.summary: Donald Trump's description of Greenland echoes a colonial pattern in which powerful states have dismissed sparsely populated land, ignoring Indigenous ties.

events.title: Germany news: Nationwide strikes hit public transport
events.summary: Many buses, trams and underground trains across the country will not be running amid a strike by a large union. Foreign Minister Wadephul is visiting Singapore. Read more in DW's running coverage of German news.

events.title: Handball: Germany lose to Denmark in Euro final
events.summary: Germany fell at the final hurdle at the European Men's Handball Championship, losing to co-hosts and favorites Denmark in the final. Two German players made the tournament all-star team.

events.title: Rita Süssmuth: The high-profile feminist reformer dies aged 88
events.summary: She dared to break taboos, advocated for women's rights and took part in a failed attempt to oust Chancellor Helmut Kohl as chairman of the CDU. Former President of the German Bundestag Rita Süssmuth has died aged 88.

events.title: Germany: Afghanistan's consulates pose threat to refugees
events.summary: Afghanistan's consulates in Germany are being taken over by Taliban officials, putting Afghan people at the mercy of the regime they fled.

events.title: The hidden money behind deep-sea mining
events.summary: A DW investigation traces the hidden financial web behind deep-sea mining — an industry scientists say remains poorly understood, yet capable of causing irreversible harm to oceans worldwide.

events.title: An undying trend: How vampires like those in 'Sinners' hold a mirror to society
events.summary: As the horror movie "Sinners" stands poised to sweep the Oscars, we take a look at how and why the vampire genre has long captivated audiences — from folklore to film. Is this trend truly immortal?

events.title: Germany's AfD bonds with Austrian far-right extremists
events.summary: Officials from the far-right Alternative for Germany (AfD) party have been openly rubbing shoulders with Austrian right-wing extremist Martin Sellner. This, despite reservations over his Identitarian Movement.

events.title: Canadian actress Catherine O'Hara dies at 71
events.summary: Catherine O'Hara was famous for starring roles in the series "Schitt's Creek" and the "Home Alone" movies. She got her start with the Second City Toronto comedy troupe in the 1970s before her career in Hollywood.

events.title: EU asylum policy: What changes for refugees in Germany?
events.summary: The German government is about to implement the EU's Common European Asylum System (CEAS) to limit irregular migration and speed up asylum procedures.

events.title: 2026 Winter Olympics: Fun events, but what about the bill?
events.summary: Preparations for the 2026 Winter Olympics in Milan and Cortina have been far from perfect. Should the Olympics hosting model be changed?

events.title: Trial against German Carnival satirist Tilly underway in Russia
events.summary: Jacques Tilly's Carnival floats mocking Vladimir Putin have landed him before a Moscow court. As the trial drags on, the Dusseldorf-based satirist has denounced the charges as an assault on freedom of expression.

events.title: Silver: Why the price of 'poor man's gold' has hit a record
events.summary: The price of silver has just reached an all-time high of more than $120 per ounce. Although gold has eclipsed the white metal as a store of value, DW explores why silver is regaining global relevance.

events.title: Germany's Bundeswehr goes on military spending spree
events.summary: Germany is spending more on weapons and military equipment than ever before. For the first time, this also includes combat drones.

events.title: Anti-woke Germans in Russia used as propaganda for Putin
events.summary: Media in Moscow are selling a narrative of mass Western migration to Russia, especially from Germany. Numbers contradict the Kremlin's claims.

events.title: Trump tariffs, dollar's dip a double-hit to eurozone exports
events.summary: The euro has reached its highest level against the US dollar since 2021. That has consequences for eurozone companies and consumers, but few think that the European Central Bank should intervene yet.

events.title: Senegal and Morocco fined and banned after AFCON final chaos
events.summary: Africa's governing football body has issued more than $1 million in fines after the chaotic scenes at the end of the AFCON final. In addition, a number of players and Senegal's coach face bans.

events.title: Why fans are obsessed with 'Bridgerton'
events.summary: Opulent romance, a diverse cast and plotlines that meld fairytales with a modern zeitgeist: "Bridgerton" has redefined the period-piece genre.

events.title: Heating with air conditioning saves on cost and cuts CO2
events.summary: From Japan to China and the US to Scandinavia, heating with air conditioning has long been standard practice. But now warming homes with AC is catching on in other parts of the world.

events.title: Tesla profit slumps amid lower EV sales, AI spending surge
events.summary: With increased competition and heavy attention on the antics of the company's CEO, Tesla's core electric vehicle business has faltered in the past year.

events.title: German development policy: Partners in the Global South
events.summary: The Federal Minister for Economic Cooperation and Development is focusing on solidarity and partnership in turbulent geopolitical times. Alabali Radovan's trip to Sierra Leone in West Africa illustrates what this means.

events.title: Arctic scientists 'feel pretty uncomfortable' on Greenland
events.summary: Science in the Arctic — and Greenland — is on the frontline of pressing challenges facing humanity, like climate change and genetics. Some researchers worry international collaboration is at risk.

events.title: CDU, Merz target 'lifestyle part-time' work in Germany
events.summary: A proposal from the economic wing of Germany’s CDU to place tighter restrictions on part-time contracts has come under heavy scrutiny. Chancellor Merz has repeatedly criticized the German work ethic in the past year.

events.title: Amazon cuts more corporate jobs in post-pandemic downsize
events.summary: Amazon told employees that it was cutting 16,000 corporate jobs, completing a downsizing move that began last year. The online retail giant had recruited during a COVID pandemic spike in demand.

events.title: Environmental crises add to Iran's mounting troubles
events.summary: Widespread discontent in Iran has sent millions of protesters into the streets. Poor environmental planning embodies one of the government's most existential vulnerabilities.

events.title: How Germany's skilled worker gap exposes migration hurdles
events.summary: Germany is facing a massive shortage of skilled workers, from nurses to IT specialists. The country needs hundreds of thousands of professionals, but bureaucracy and political hurdles are slowing recruitment abroad.

events.title: What 'banana republic' means — and why its history matters
events.summary: From plantations to political rhetoric, the term's evolution shows how a violent past can fade into metaphor, sometimes obscuring its true history.

events.title: How does Germany deport people?
events.summary: Germany does not have masked ICE officers or an equivalent agency, but both Chancellor Friedrich Merz and his predecessor have done all they can to accelerate deportations. Here's how the process works.

events.title: FIFA ex-President Blatter backs call to boycott World Cup
events.summary: With the US due to co-host the football World Cup this summer, former FIFA President Sepp Blatter said a former colleague was "right" to advise supporters to "stay home" and watch on TV amid an immigration crackdown.

events.title: Germany's Green Party under pressure over Mercosur vote
events.summary: The Greens are big supporters of international agreements. But, now, eight German lawmakers in the European Parliament have all but scuppered the Mercosur free trade agreement — defying their party's leadership.

events.title: Protests in Iran: Ali Karimi leads sports' call for support
events.summary: Former Iran and Bayern Munich footballer Ali Karimi has signed an open letter, asking FIFA to act. He is not the only athlete to be vocal.

events.title: Plastic emissions could double health damage by 2040
events.summary: Plastic pollution could double its harm to human health in the coming decades if current production trends continue, according to a new study that links rising risks directly to the manufacture of new plastics.

events.title: IOC rejects extra Winter Olympics spot for skeleton's Uhlaender
events.summary: IOC President Kirsty Coventry had been asked to intervene after Katie Uhlaender was the victim of alleged competition manipulation, causing her to miss out on February's Winter Olympics.

events.title: German FA boss says World Cup boycott would be 'misguided'
events.summary: At the first DFL meeting of 2026, German FA boss Bernd Neuendorf spoke for the first time about a World Cup boycott.

events.title: Holocaust survivor Leon Weintraub: "We were dehumanized"
events.summary: The 100-year-old vividly recalls the hunger, death camps and cruelty of the guards. Thus, he tirelessly works to ensure that the Holocaust is never forgotten.

events.title: Paris Agreement 10 years on: More wins than you may realize
events.summary: Major emitter the US has officially left the Paris Agreement and global emissions keep rising a decade on from the deal. Yet renewables' growth shows climate action can work. Here's what's been done and what's missing.

events.title: Australian Open tennis encounters extreme heat
events.summary: Tournament organizers have instituted their extreme heat protocols amid blistering temperatures in the region.

events.title: Ye aka Kanye West apologizes for antisemitic remarks
events.summary: The artist previously known as Kanye West blamed his behavior on bipolar disorder, saying he "lost touch with reality."

events.title: Berlin's young Jews reveal complex experiences with antisemitism
events.summary: Jewish people in Berlin have had varying experiences since October 7, 2023, but several DW spoke to say they have seen more antisemitism and have become increasingly cautious.

events.title: Germany, France, others rebuke Trump's NATO troop disrespect
events.summary: German Defense Minister Boris Pistorius said it would show "decency" for Donald Trump to apologize for comments on NATO troops in Afghanistan. "But we all know how the US president operates," Pistorius added.

events.title: Gold breaks $5,000: What's fueling the price rally and where will it end?
events.summary: Gold continues to hit record highs, having already had a bumper run in 2025. Geopolitical and economic uncertainty are the key factors, while doubts over the US dollar are also attracting new investors.

events.title: EU pushes for deals as Trump's tariffs upset global trade
events.summary: Fear over Trump's tariff walls and the aggressive tone coming from the White House is pushing the European Union to focus on getting other trade agreements done. Despite all efforts, the EU sometimes gets in its own way.

events.title: Germany: Business index starts year with 'little momentum'
events.summary: Germany's Ifo business barometer was stagnant in January, bucking predictions of a slight improvement. A dip in confidence in the service sector put the brakes on improved sentiments in other areas.

events.title: Calls grow for European teams to boycott World Cup 2026
events.summary: As with Russia in 2018 and Qatar in 2022, politics are dominating the buildup to North America's 2026 World Cup. Could discontent with Donald Trump in Europe see football heavyweights unite to boycott the tournament?

events.title: US–EU economic ties show why neither side can decouple
events.summary: Despite a pause in tariff escalation, US–EU trade remains volatile under Donald Trump. From deficits and energy to services and the dollar, the trans-Atlantic relationship reveals deep ties — and clear vulnerabilities.

events.title: Germany weighs boon and bane of China's industrial expansion
events.summary: From cheap exports to cutting-edge tech: A Chinese battery giant's secretive factory in Germany shows how "Made in China" and "Made in Germany" are colliding — and where they can benefit from each other.

events.title: 'Sweet Caroline' singer Neil Diamond turns 85
events.summary: He was a pop icon in the 1970s. Today, one of his songs is experiencing a viral resurgence. From soccer stadiums to TikTok, Neil Diamond's "Sweet Caroline" hasn't stopped playing.

events.title: Rodman becomes new 'highest paid' women's footballer
events.summary: USA forward Trinity Rodman has re-signed with the Washington Spirit of the National Women's Soccer League in a deal that will reportedly pay her in excess of $2 million per season.

events.title: Trump, Zelenskyy, Carney dominate Davos 2026: As it happened
events.summary: The World Economic Forum has come to an end after a tense but ultimately anti-climactic week at Davos, with the US, Ukrainian and Canadian leaders attracting the most attention. Read DW's wrap of the summit.

events.title: Can China rely on domestic oil after Iran, Venezuela shocks?
events.summary: Donald Trump's moves against two key suppliers have revived debate over China’s fragile oil balance. With domestic output flat and oil fields aging, how much capacity — if any — exists to raise production?

events.title: 'Sinners' breaks records at 2026 Oscar nominations
events.summary: The film by Ryan Coogler earned 16 nods for the 98th Academy Awards, which will be presented on March 15. A new Oscar category was also introduced for the first time in 25 years.

events.title: From Inuit to Vikings to Trump: The history of Greenland
events.summary: After being inhabited only by Indigenous peoples for centuries, the Arctic island saw the Vikings in the 10th century and the Danes in 1721, and it attracted US interest back in 1867.

events.title: UN backs boost in nature-saving business
events.summary: Global financing is heavily skewed to industries that harm rather than preserve nature, according to a new report that calls for an urgent scale-up of nature-positive spending.

events.title: Davos WEF: Trump touts policies, renews Greenland ambitions
events.summary: Donald Trump used his WEF speech to praise himself and lash out at Europe while offering little on the economy. Business and political leaders were expecting the worst, but much of it was for a domestic audience.

events.title: Free solo climb on Netflix: 'If you fall, you're gonna die'
events.summary: Rock climber Alex Honnold plans to scale the facade of what was once the world's tallest building — live on Netflix. But not all are impressed by the idea.

events.title: Halabja Massacre: Survivors still haunted by chemical weapons strike
events.summary: Kurdish Iraqis who survived the 1988 chemical weapons attack on Halabja and nearby communities have lasting trauma, a new report finds, highlighting the need for long-term support.

events.title: How bringing back a humble algae to Arctic waters makes all the difference
events.summary: For decades, researchers in northern Norway had tried to bring back vital kelp forests after overfishing damaged marine ecosystems. Now a simple solution is proving successful.

events.title: Like potatoes? Berlin is giving away 4 million kilos
events.summary: As an initiative redistributes a bumper surplus of spuds, here's a look at the Germans' great love affair with the potato.

events.title: Meet Veronika, the clever cow with tools to scratch herself
events.summary: A cow in Austria has been observed using tools ― the first time such behavior has been recorded in cattle. Have we underestimated the gentle bovines all this time?

events.title: 'Sentimental Value' sweeps European Film Awards. Next step, Oscars?
events.summary: Joachim Trier's drama won the top accolades, adding to the buzz ahead of the Oscar awards. Iran was also in the spotlight, with director Jafar Panahi decrying the government's brutal crackdown on protest.

events.title: 8 fun facts about Dolly Parton for her 80th birthday
events.summary: Dolly Parton is one of the world's most successful artists. Now 80, she has an eventful life to look back over. Here are some important and extraordinary facts about the country music icon.

events.title: How European cinema is stealing Hollywood's spotlight
events.summary: As Hollywood doubles down on sequels, the contenders for the European Film Awards feature bold, political works that are challenging audiences and creating buzz far beyond the continent.

events.title: 2026 stargazing: Eclipses, meteor showers and supermoons
events.summary: 2026 will leave stargazers spoiled for sights in the sky, with four eclipse events, multiple meteor showers and several supermoons.

events.title: Livestream: 4 award-winning filmmakers discuss risk-taking cinema
events.summary: DW co-hosts a talk with European Film Award and Oscar nominees Jafar Panahi, Oliver Laxe, Mascha Schilinski and Joachim Trier. Watch it live here.

events.title: 'Charlie Hebdo' cartoon on Swiss fire tragedy sparks outrage
events.summary: A cartoon by the French satirical weekly portraying the deadly fire in Crans-Montana as the "comedy of the year" provokes disgust.

events.title: Wikipedia at 25: Of collective knowledge and its fault lines
events.summary: From utopian origins to AI-driven rivals, the "people's encyclopedia" has been shaped by debates over neutrality, expertise and the future of shared knowledge.

events.title: International Space Station crew to make emergency return to Earth
events.summary: A medical emergency will force four astronauts aboard the International Space Station to return to Earth prematurely.

events.title: Australians are changing their response to wildfires
events.summary: DW's Stuart Braun had a dangerously near miss during Australia's 2009 "Black Saturday" inferno. As this month's fires burned near his rural home, he wasn't taking any chances.

events.title: Cannabis: Now you can measure how much is too much
events.summary: At what point does smoking weed get dangerous? A British study measured cannabis consumption in THC units and determined which amounts increase health risks. The system comes with clear risk thresholds ― and weaknesses.

events.title: 'Part of the city': New York seeks rights for beloved 'bodega cats'
events.summary: They are a New York institution as beloved as yellow cabs or pizza by the slice but the city's bodega cats, whose job is to catch mice in neighbourhood shops, are not technically legal. Elected representatives in New York now want to legalise shop cats but there are disagreements over the responsibilities a new law should confer on owners. Oliver Farry takes a look.

events.title: Two Senegalese celebrities arrested in high-profile 'anti-gay' case
events.summary: PRESS REVIEW – Tuesday, February 10: Police in Senegal have arrested over a dozen men, including a well-known TV presenter and a musician, in a case involving "unnatural acts" – parlance for gay sex. The New York Times calls it Senegal's most high-profile anti-gay case in years. Also in the country, a horrific paedophile ring spearheaded by a French man leads to multiple arrests. Finally, who is Ilia Malinin, the US figure skater who is revolutionising the sport?

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein case: Ghislaine Maxwell declines to answer questions in House deposition
events.summary: Ghislaine #Maxwell invoked her Fifth Amendment right and refused to answer questions at a #US House deposition. Convicted in 2021 in the #Epstein case, she is serving a 20-year sentence as new #DOJ documents bring the case back into focus.

events.title: Palestinians return to Gaza after long-awaited Rafah reopening
events.summary: Gazans who have been stuck for months in Egypt and separated from their families have started returning to the enclave after the reopening of the Rafah border crossing. The vital border point opened last week for the first time since mid-2024, one of the main requirements for the US-backed ceasefire between Israel and Hamas.

events.title: Iran operating in altered 'strategic environment' amid domestic unrest and intense US pressure
events.summary: Jean-Emile Jammine is pleased to welcome Dr Burcu Ozcelik, Senior Research Fellow for Middle East Security at RUSI. The landscape in the Middle East has vastly changed since the 12-day war. Dr Ozcelik sees a strategic misreading at play on the part of Iran failing to grasp the recalibrated thresholds domestically, regionally and across the globe. And now the US is willing to apply a maximalist pressure strategy involving military, economic, and diplomatic levers to extract more than mere nuclear compliance.

events.title: Starmer 'clinging on by his teeth' as fallout from Epstein files spreads
events.summary: UK premier Keir Starmer insisted he would not "walk away" on Monday after a prominent ally demanded the prime minister quit for embroiling the British government in the Jeffrey Epstein scandal. Scottish Labour leader Anas Sarwar called on Starmer to resign for appointing Peter Mandelson as US ambassador despite knowing he had maintained links to Epstein. But even as senior ministers rally around the beleaguered PM, it was clear Starmer is “clinging on by his teeth”, says France 24’s Philip Turle.

events.title: Meta, Google stand trial over accusations apps designed to addict children
events.summary: A landmark trial began in a California court Monday in which social media giants Meta and Google-owned YouTube stand accused of designing their apps to be addictive to children. "This case is about two of the richest corporations in history who have engineered addiction in children's brains," plaintiffs' attorney Mark Lanier told the jury in his opening statement.

events.title: French left calls for Epstein inquiry as Macron says scandal 'mainly concerns' US
events.summary: The head of France's National Assembly on Tuesday pushed back against opposition calls for a parliamentary inquiry into Jeffrey Epstein's links to the French political and cultural elite, a day after President Emmanuel Macron said the scandal involving the late sex offender was "a matter that mainly concerns the United States".

events.title: US social media companies on trial over accusations they engineered 'addiction' for children
events.summary: Meta Platforms and YouTube defended themselves in a landmark civil suit in Los Angeles on Monday, where they were accused of purposely designing their products to cause addiction in children. The US's leading tech companies are facing several similar court cases across the country. Also in this edition, French President Emmanuel Macron calls for the EU to launch a joint borrowing mechanism to invest in AI, green tech and quantum computing.

events.title: 'Bonaly flip': Olympic skating backflip sparks tributes to French trailblazer
events.summary: US figure skater Ilia Malinin's gold-medal-clinching backflip at the Winter Olympics in Milan-Cortina has prompted a flurry of tributes to France's Surya Bonaly, who became the first skater to land the daring flip on one skate at the Nagano Games almost three decades ago – when the move was still forbidden.

events.title: Trump threatens to block opening of Ontario-Michigan bridge financed by Canada
events.summary: US President Donald Trump has threatened to bar a new $4.7 billion bridge connecting Michigan and Ontario from opening, in his latest salvo against Canada over trade issues. Trump said the US should own "at least half" of the forthcoming Gordie Howe International Bridge that has been entirely financed by Canada.

events.title: Ukraine war live: Macron aims to reopen Putin dialogue with 'European approach'
events.summary: French President Emmanuel Macron has said he wants to include European partners in a resumption of dialogue with Russian leader Vladimir Putin after dispatching a top adviser to Moscow last week, in the first such meeting since Moscow's invasion of Ukraine four years ago. Follow our live blog for the latest updates on the war in Ukraine.

events.title: 2026 Olympics: No medals for France so far, Cizeron and Fournier Beaudry in the lead
events.summary: There were no French medals on Monday, February 9 at the Winter Olympics. However, Valentin Foubert came close to achieving a remarkable feat in ski jumping. Meanwhile, French ice dancers Guillaume Cizeron and Laurence Fournier Beaudry surged to a surprise lead in the figure skating competition.

events.title: Iran escalates crackdown on protestors amid potential US nuclear talks
events.summary: Iran intensified its suppression of domestic dissent on Monday, arresting reformist figures and activists weeks after a wave of nationwide protests. At the same time, Tehran left the door open to further nuclear negotiations with the United States, highlighting a dual approach of domestic control and cautious diplomacy.

events.title: South Korea investigators raid spy agencies over drone flights into North
events.summary: South Korean investigators on Tuesday raided multiple sites including the country's Defense Intelligence Command and the National Intelligence Service as part of an investigation into alleged drone flights over North Korea. Officials said three active-duty soldiers and one spy agency employee were under investigation in the widening case that has rattled Seoul.

events.title: 'Bodega cats': New York seeks rights for corner shops' furry little helpers
events.summary: Proposals submitted in the New York City Council and the state legislature aim to establish health and safety standards for cats living in retails stores, and shield the owners of the city's iconic "bodega cats" from penalties.

events.title: US forces board sanctioned tanker after globe-spanning pursuit
events.summary: US military forces have boarded a sanctioned oil tanker in the Indian Ocean after tracking it from the Caribbean, Defence Secretary Pete Hegseth said on Monday, marking a major escalation in the Trump administration’s campaign to enforce an oil quarantine on Venezuela and seize vessels accused of evading sanctions.

events.title: IOC bans helmet honouring Ukraine's war dead at Olympics, allows black armband
events.summary: Ukraine's Vladyslav Heraskevych will not be allowed to wear a "helmet of remembrance" in honour of those killed in the war with Russia in the skeleton competition at the Winter Games, the International Olympic Committee said on Tuesday, adding that it would allow the Ukrainian flag bearer to wear a black armband instead.

events.title: UN presses for clarity on nearly $4 billion owed by US as financial crisis looms
events.summary: The United Nations says it is awaiting confirmation from the Trump administration on how much of the nearly $4 billion owed by the United States it plans to pay, and when the funds will be transferred, as the world body warns it could face a cash shortfall by mid-year.

events.title: Rubio to visit Hungary and Slovakia after Trump backs right-wing leader Orban
events.summary: US Secretary of State Marco Rubio will travel next week to Hungary and Slovakia after President Donald Trump publicly endorsed Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban, a right-wing ally who is trailing in polls ahead of April elections, the State Department said on Monday.

events.title: 'It's a chicken or egg question': Expert says digital economy can empower nations
events.summary: The digital economy now accounts for 17 percent of global GDP and is worth over $20 trillion, according to a new report by the International Data Centre Authority (IDCA). But growth has been uneven across the world, with more than 1 billion people having poor access to electricity. IDCA's CEO Mehdi Paryavi tells FRANCE 24 that poorer nations can develop digital economies that can empower those nations and improve energy access and education.

events.title: Hong Kong mogul Jimmy Lai's jailing sparks outcry
events.summary: FRANCE 24's Mark Owen speaks with Thibault Bruttin, Director General of Reporters Sans Frontières, about the sentencing of Hong Kong democracy advocate and media magnate Jimmy Lai. The 78-year-old was sentenced to 20 years in prison after being found guilty in December of conspiracy to collude with foreign forces and conspiring with others to publish seditious articles.

events.title: Landmark trial accusing social media companies of addicting children to their platforms begins
events.summary: The world's biggest social media companies face several landmark trials this year that seek to hold them responsible for harms to children who use their platforms. Opening statements for the first, in Los Angeles County Superior Court, began on Monday. Instagram's parent company Meta and Google's YouTube will face claims that their platforms deliberately addict and harm children. FRANCE 24's Sharon Gaffney speaks with data scientist, former whistleblower at Facebook and advocate for social media accountability, Frances Haugen.

events.title: Hong Kong leader celebrates Jimmy Lai's sentence - as plan to enhance security law published
events.summary: The leader of Hong Kong has celebrated the 20-year jail sentence given to British pro-democracy campaigner Jimmy Lai, saying the media tycoon had "poisoned" the city.

events.title: Lindsey Vonn reveals extent of injuries after Winter Olympics crash
events.summary: US skier Lindsey Vonn says she has "no regrets" despite confirming she needs "multiple surgeries" after suffering a leg fracture in a crash at the Winter Olympics.

events.title: Have a baby while you still can, France to tell 29-year-olds
events.summary: All 29-year-old French citizens are to be encouraged by their government to have babies while they still can.

events.title: DNA found on gun is match to both identical twins - so who is the killer?
events.summary: Prosecutors in France have been unable to tell which of a pair of identical twins on trial for murder pulled the trigger in a fatal shooting, because DNA found on a gun is a match to them both.

events.title: Tear gas and pepper spray used on Australian protesters opposing Israeli president's visit
events.summary: Police have reportedly used pepper spray and tear gas as thousands of people held protests in Australia over the visit of Israeli president Isaac Herzog.

events.title: Prince William asked to raise case of detained Manchester man during visit to Saudi Arabia
events.summary: The Prince of Wales has been asked to raise the case of a Manchester man detained in Saudi Arabia during his first official trip to the country.

events.title: Face of a 'vampire': Why this man was decapitated after death
events.summary: The face of a "vampire" whose remains were posthumously mutilated to prevent them rising from the dead can be seen for the first time in more than 400 years.

events.title: Irish man detained for months in 'concentration camp' by ICE
events.summary: An Irishman who has been detained by ICE for five months has described the facilities as "like a modern-day concentration camp".

events.title: Man who killed 51 Muslim worshippers blames guilty plea on prison 'conditions'
events.summary: A white supremacist who killed 51 Muslim worshippers at two mosques in New Zealand in 2019 said on Monday that he was irrational when he pleaded guilty, as he sought to ⁠overturn his conviction.

events.title: Social media goes on trial in LA - here's what you need to know
events.summary: Social media is on trial in Los Angeles. What happens next could change the way they operate.

events.title: US won't abandon the Philippines in fighting China's assertiveness at sea, Manila's envoy says
events.summary: Manila’s envoy to Washington is expressing confidence that the United States will not abandon the Philippines as it defies Beijing’s assertiveness in the disputed South China Sea — even as Donald Trump and Xi Jinping seek more direct talks to resolve t...

events.title: South Korea will boost medical school admissions to tackle physician shortage
events.summary: South Korea plans to increase medical school admissions by over 3,340 students from 2027 to 2031 to address physician shortages

events.title: Russia thinks it can outsmart the US during Ukraine talks, intelligence chief says
events.summary: Russian President Vladimir Putin shows no desire to end Russia’s invasion of Ukraine, according to a senior European intelligence official

events.title: Honda reports declining profit as Trump's tariffs and EV moves hurt Japanese automaker's results
events.summary: Honda has reported a 42% drop in profit for the nine months through December compared to a year earlier

events.title: China’s Lunar New Year travel rush begins with record 9.5 billion trips expected
events.summary: Hundreds of millions of people in China are heading to their hometowns this week for the Lunar New Year festival

events.title: Misery deepens in the West Bank as Israel provides few Palestinian work permits
events.summary: Many Palestinians in the occupied West Bank are struggling to get by after losing their permits to work inside Israel

events.title: Netanyahu wants Trump to demand more from Iran. The leaders will meet this week
events.summary: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is heading to Washington to encourage President Donald Trump to expand the scope of high-stakes nuclear talks with Iran
